id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [Pulse Counter Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/pulse_counter.html#configuration-variables)*

pin.docs:
**[Pin](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin)**: The pin to count pulses on.

*See also: [Pulse Counter Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/pulse_counter.html#configuration-variables)*

rising_edge.docs:
What to do when a rising edge is detected. One of `DISABLE`, `INCREMENT` and `DECREMENT`. Defaults to `INCREMENT`.

*See also: [Pulse Counter Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/pulse_counter.html#configuration-variables)*

falling_edge.docs:
What to do when a falling edge is detected. One of `DISABLE`, `INCREMENT` and `DECREMENT`. Defaults to `DISABLE`.

*See also: [Pulse Counter Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/pulse_counter.html#configuration-variables)*

count_mode.docs:
Configure how the counter should behave on a detected rising edge/falling edge.
  * **rising_edge** (*Optional*): What to do when a rising edge is detected. One of `DISABLE`, `INCREMENT` and `DECREMENT`. Defaults to `INCREMENT`.
  
  * **falling_edge** (*Optional*): What to do when a falling edge is detected. One of `DISABLE`, `INCREMENT` and `DECREMENT`. Defaults to `DISABLE`.
  
  

*See also: [Pulse Counter Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/pulse_counter.html#configuration-variables)*

use_pcnt.docs:
**boolean**: Use hardware `PCNT` pulse counter. Only supported on ESP32. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [Pulse Counter Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/pulse_counter.html#configuration-variables)*

internal_filter.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: If a pulse shorter than this time is detected, it’s discarded and no pulse is counted. Defaults to `13us`. On the ESP32, when using the hardware pulse counter this value can not be higher than `13us`, for the ESP8266 or with `use_pcnt: false` you can use larger intervals too. If you enable this, set up the `count_mode` to increase on the falling edge, not leading edge. For S0 pulse meters that are used to meter power consumption 50-100 ms is a reasonable value.

*See also: [Pulse Counter Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/pulse_counter.html#configuration-variables)*

total.docs:
Report the total number of pulses.

*See also: [Pulse Counter Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/pulse_counter.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to check the sensor. Defaults to `60s`.

*See also: [Pulse Counter Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/pulse_counter.html#configuration-variables)*
